Semi-front - Utils Functions

MEDprofiles utils

Utils functions for manipulation of MEDprofile figure.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.center_data_in_profile_plot(dict_points)

Center plot on current data.

Parameters:

dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.display_annotations(event)

Display or hide the nearest annotation.

Parameters:

event – Matplotlib Event object.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.display_profile(axes, df_profile, classes_attributes_dict, color='black', xaxis=['Date'])

Scatter points and their annotations in the profile figure.

Parameters:

  • axes – Axes where we want to plot the profile.

  • df_profile – Pandas dataframe of a MEDprofile.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • color – Desired color for scatter points.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

points, annotations : List of points and list of annotations plotted in the MEDprofile plot.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.get_axes_index_of_class(axes, class_)

Return a list of the axes indexes related to the specified class.

Parameters:

  • axes – Axes from a MEDprofile plot.

  • class – Classname string of the class to consider.

Returns:

index_list: List of the axes indexes related to the specified class.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.get_class(event)

Get class of the axis where the event occurs.

Parameters:

event – Matplotlib Event object.

Returns:

Matching class or None.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.get_class_fields(class_)

Get class attributes.

Parameters:

class – Classname as string.

Returns:

List of the class attributes.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.get_event_children_of_instance(event, instance)

Return children of the specified instance from an event.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • instance – Type of data we are looking for.

Returns:

children: List of event’s children of type instance.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.get_nb_rows(classes_attributes_dict)

Count number of rows necessary to plot the figure.

Parameters:

classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

Returns:

nb_row : Number of row in the graphic according to classes_attributes_dict.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.get_nearest_child(event, children)

Return the nearest child from the event.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • children – List of event’s children to consider.

Returns:

nearest_child : Nearest child from the event.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.get_x_y_marker(df_profile_not_na, i, xaxis)

Return x, y and marker for scatter profile point and annotations

Parameters:

  • df_profile_not_na – Not null values from a profile dataframe.

  • i – Index of the point we want to consider in the profile dataframe.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

x, y, marker

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.is_time_relative_to_selected_class(event, xaxis, df)

Return True if the event occurs on the axe of the relative class for time.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

  • df – Profile or cohort dataframe.

Returns:

True if time is relative to the event class, False otherwise.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.r_pressed_in_profile(event, axes, df_profile, classes_attributes_dict, xaxis, dict_points, dict_annotations)

Called when button r is pressed on a profile figure. Set or remove the relative time.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • axes – Axes from a MEDprofile plot.

  • df_profile – Pandas dataframe of a MEDprofile.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.remove_from_plot(data)

Remove data from plot.

Parameters:

data – List of data present in a plot.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.scatter_and_annotate_point(axes, index, x, y, color, size, marker, data_text, index_text, points, annotations)

Create scatter and annotation for a plot and put it in points and annotations list.

Parameters:

  • axes – Axes from the considered plot.

  • index – Index of the axe we want to scatter and annotate.

  • x – Abscissa coordinate of the point to scatter and annotate.

  • y – Ordinate coordinate of the point to scatter and annotate.

  • color – Desired color for the scatter.

  • size – Desired size for the scatter.

  • marker – Desired marker for the scatter.

  • data_text – Data to set as annotation.

  • index_text – Index to set as annotation.

  • points – List of scatter points.

  • annotations – List of annotations.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.set_absolute_time_in_profile_plot(axes, df_profile, classes_attributes_dict, xaxis, dict_points, dict_annotations)

Display profile by absolute time in plot.

Parameters:

  • axes – Axes from a MEDprofile plot.

  • df_profile – Pandas dataframe of a MEDprofile.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.set_legend(fig, df_cohort)

Set legend in plot according to time_points present in the figure.

Parameters:

  • fig – A MEDprofile plot.

  • df_cohort – A MEDprofile pandas dataframe.

Returns:

legend_points: list of according to the different time points in the figure.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.set_plot(subplot_height, plot_width, classes_attributes_dict, colors)

Set plots and sublopts with table names and colors to display profile.

Parameters:

  • subplot_height – Desired height for each subplot.

  • plot_width – Desired width for the plot.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • colors – List of colors, there is at least one color per class.

Returns:

fig, axes: Elements of the created plot.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.set_relative_time_in_profile_plot(event, axes, df_profile, classes_attributes_dict, xaxis, dict_points, dict_annotations)

Set relative time considering the class associated to axis where the event happens.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • axes – Axes from a MEDprofile plot.

  • df_profile – Pandas dataframe of a MEDprofile.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.set_time_relative_to_class_in_profile(df_profile, cls)

Set relative time at cls in df_profile.

Parameters:

  • df_profile – MEDprofile pandas dataframe.

  • cls – Classname string of the class we consider.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDprofiles_utils.table_design(table, color)

Set the design for the table column associated with each subplot.

Parameters:

  • table – Table element in the plot.

  • color – Color we want to associate to the table.

Returns:

MEDcohort utils

Utils functions for manipulation of MEDcohort figure.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.center_data_in_cohort(dict_points, dict_selected_points)

Center plot on current data.

Parameters:

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.delete_pressed(dict_points, dict_selected_points, dict_selected_annotations, title)

Delete selected patients and update figure title.

Parameters:

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • dict_selected_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • title – Matplotlib title of a MEDcohort figure.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.deselect_patient(patient_id, axes, df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, dict_points, dict_annotations, dict_selected_points, dict_selected_annotations, xaxis=['Date'])

Deselect all data from a patient in the given axes.

Parameters:

  • patient_id – PatientID of a MEDprofile.

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • dict_selected_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.display_attributes_values(event, df_cohort)

Show or hide attributes values from the nearest point of the event.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.display_cohort(axes, df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, dict_points, dict_annotations, xaxis=['Date'])

Display a cohort given axes, classes and attributes per classes with type of display by class (compact or complete).

Parameters:

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.display_patient_id_and_data(event, axes, df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, dict_points, dict_annotations, dict_selected_points, dict_selected_annotations, xaxis=['Date'])

Select or deselect patient’s points on the axes.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • dict_selected_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.get_patient_list_for_class_values_at_date(df_cohort, class_, date)

Return patient list containing value(s) given a class and a time interval.

Parameters:

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • class – Class name of the considered class as string.

  • date – Date we consider.

Returns:

List of PatientID in the cohort matching the date.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.is_class_associated_to_time_point(class_, dict_class_time_points)

Return True if class where the event occurs is associated to a time point.

Parameters:

  • class – class_ from MEDprofile object.

  • dict_class_time_points – Dict associating class names to their matching time points.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.r_pressed(event, axes, df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, dict_points, dict_annotations, dict_selected_points, dict_selected_annotations, xaxis)

Set relative time at the class matching the axis in which the event occurs. If time is already relative to the class, set absolute time. If there isn’t time point notion (ie every data is at the same date) we set time relative to the data point selected . If the class contains points at different time for at least one patient, the relative time is set to the nearest point from the event.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • dict_selected_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.remove_selected_patients(dict_selected_points, dict_selected_annotations)

Remove selected patients from plot.

Parameters:

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • dict_selected_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.remove_time_point(class_, df_cohort, dict_class_time_points)

Remove the time point attributed to a class, update the superiors time points and update cohort.

Parameters:

  • class – class associated to a MEDprofile object.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • dict_class_time_points – Dict associating class names to their matching time points.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.scatter_bin_points(axes, classes_attributes_dict, data_dict, dict_bin_points, dict_bin_annotations)

Scatter bin points according to data_dict.

Parameters:

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • data_dict – Dict where keys are time intervals and values are list of lists of patients (one list per class).

  • dict_bin_points – Dict of scatter points representing a bin of patients.

  • dict_bin_annotations – Dict of annotations representing a bin of patients.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.select_patient(patient_id, axes, df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, dict_points, dict_annotations, dict_selected_points, dict_selected_annotations, color='red', xaxis=['Date'])

Select all data from a patient in the given axes.

Parameters:

  • patient_id – PatientID of a MEDprofile.

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • dict_selected_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • color – Desired color for the selected points.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.set_in_bin(df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, frequency)

Create data dict given classes and frequency.

Parameters:

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • frequency – “Month” or “Year” depending if we want to set the bin by month or year.

Returns:

data_dict: Dict where keys are time intervals and values are list of lists of patients (one list per class)

.

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.set_time_point(class_, df_cohort, dict_class_time_points)

Attribute a time point to a class and update cohort.

Parameters:

  • class – Class associated to a MEDprofile object.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • dict_class_time_points – Dict associating class names to their matching time points.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.set_time_relative_to_class_in_cohort(df_cohort, cls)

Set relative time at cls in df_cohort.

Parameters:

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • cls – Class name of considered class as string.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.t_pressed(event, axes, df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, dict_points, dict_annotations, dict_selected_points, dict_selected_annotations, xaxis, dict_class_time_points, legend_points, fig)

Set time points according to the class matching the event place.

Parameters:

  • event – Matplotlib Event object.

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • dict_selected_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

  • dict_class_time_points – Dict associating class names to their matching time points.

  • legend_points – Legend of a MEDcohort figure.

  • fig – A MEDcohort figure.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.update_cohort(df_cohort, dict_points, dict_selected_points)

Update cohort dataframe according to dict_points keys.

Parameters:

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.update_plot(axes, df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, dict_points, dict_annotations, dict_selected_points, dict_selected_annotations, xaxis)

Update plot, dict of points and annotations and dict of selected points and selected annotations according to cohort.

Parameters:

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • dict_selected_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.update_plot_one_dict(axes, df_cohort, classes_attributes_dict, dict_points, dict_annotations, color, xaxis)

Update plot and dict of points and annotations according to the cohort.

Parameters:

  • axes – Axes from a MEDcohort plot.

  • df_cohort – Pandas Dataframe of a MEDcohort.

  • classes_attributes_dict – Dict associating classes to the attributes we want to display and format (one row for the class or one row by attributes to display in the class). Keys are class names and values are tuples (list of attributes, format), with format equals to ‘compact’ or ‘complete’.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_annotations – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding annotations in Axes.

  • color – Desired color for the selected points.

  • xaxis – From which abscissa is displayed the data.

Returns:

MEDprofiles.src.semi_front.utils.MEDcohort_utils.update_title(title, dict_points, dict_selected_points)

Update the figure suptitle.

Parameters:

  • title – Matplotlib title of a MEDcohort figure.

  • dict_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes.

  • dict_selected_points – Dict associating MEDprofile PatientID to the list of corresponding points in Axes and corresponding to the selected points in the plot.

Returns:
